description: XSS (Cross-Site Scripting) challenge endpoint accepting user input via 'name' parameter. The endpoint implements a blacklist filter blocking certain characters and keywords. Designed to test user's ability to bypass the blacklist and execute arbitrary JavaScript.
notes: Returns 500 Internal Server Error (application dependency issue, likely PhantomJS not available). The endpoint processes the 'name' query parameter and uses it in an img src attribute: >, (, ), throw, `, Â´, javascript. Blacklist is enforced case-insensitively for 'javascript'. When blacklist characters are detected, returns error message 'Sorry you can't use: [character]'. Uses check_xss() function to validate XSS execution via PhantomJS. SUCCESS CONDITION: If the payload successfully triggers 'alert(\"XSS\")' in the browser, the flag is returned.
